channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: We Must Protect One of Our Greatest National Assets from China
item.description: Our nation will not truly be secure until our farmland, food supply chain, and valuable research products are protected from malign foreign influences...

item.title: Remember When Trump was a Russian Agent?
item.description: His nuclear saber-rattling puts paid to a baseless smear.

item.title: Former General Electric CEO Jack Welch once claimed the jobs numbers were faked. How did that turn out?
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: From law firm to AI powerhouse: How Accenture’s Julie Sweet hacked the CEO track
item.description: Julie Sweet’s rise from law partner to Accenture CEO shows that curiosity and range, not credentials, are the new power skills.

item.title: Trump says he now 'loves' Sydney Sweeney American Eagle ad after learning she's a registered Republican
item.description: President Trump called Sydney Sweeney's controversial American Eagle jeans ad campaign 'fantastic' upon learning she is a registered Republican voter.

item.title: A Poet for Our Disjointed Times
item.description: Jane Greer reanchored us to what matters.

item.title: AI is coming for entry-level jobs. Bill Gates says Gen Z may not be safe no matter how well they learn to use it
item.description: Gen Z job applicants are facing headwinds when entering the job market due to AI.

item.title: Trump Is Shooting the Messenger
item.description: The economy itself is what it is, no matter how the statistics are reported.

item.title: North Korean IT worker infiltrations exploded 220% over the past 12 months, with GenAI weaponized at every stage of the hiring process
item.description: Cybersecurity firm Crowdstrike red-flags a new North Korean software development hire to clients just about once a day.

item.title: Greer says U.S.-China talks ‘about halfway there’ on rare earths
item.description: The U.S. Trade Representative said Washington was focused on having rare earth magnets "flow as freely as it did before the control."

item.title: Disappointing employment numbers, tariffs uncertainty dog Trump with Democrats seeking foothold
item.description: Weak economic indicators are making President Trump's supporters nervous and Democrats increasingly hopeful about a political comeback.
